title: Keith Miller
summary: Keith Ross Miller, AM MBE (28 November 1919 – 11 October 2004) was an Australian Test cricketer and a Royal Australian Air Force pilot during World War II. Miller is widely regarded as Australia's greatest ever all-rounder.[1] His ability, irreverent manner and good looks made him a crowd favourite.[2] English journalist Ian Wooldridge called Miller "the golden boy" of cricket, leading to his being nicknamed "Nugget".[3] He "was more than a cricketer ... he embodied the idea that there was more to life than cricket".[4]
